Yes.
Akali rework was so overloaded that even with her trailer before release to live, she was thought to be too powerful, overtuned, and overloaded. There was even a thread saying it seemed unfair to play immobile champions now because of her rework and the moment the rework was released, the amount of frustration against her was sky high (i mean it's no surprise since she is a champ designed by certainlyt, but I can't talk about him).
Her identity has been ruined. An assassin champion but played in a bruiser way. That's not even how assassins work ffs.

Note: this is before the nerfs and removal.
Akali is the only champion I know with like 8 mechanical functions in just her passive and Q in total. A slow, a heal, a movement speed buff, another movement speed buff, ranged auto, an empowered auto, energy restoration, aoe, and double ap and ad scaling. Note that all those can be enhanced with Hextech Gunblade.

Her W is probably the most toxic ability in the history of toxic abilities and simply because of one thing. True stealth. Like wtf is that? Oh so hiding under tower is now illegal? Is playing safe now a reportable offense? The fact that it hid you even under turret was the most hated and main core of frustration on Akali and riot took them exactly 8 months to remove it. 8 MONTHS! Yes, I counted.

Her E my only critic is that why does it have to be something used as an escape and also as a gap closer? Oh I mess up? I can escape. Oh you're low? If I hit you with e, there is literally no escape.

Her R since it could scale with both ad and ap (which again idk why this is a thing), had a freaken stun because why not, and even had 2 charges was something that was just pure bullshit.

EVEN after a ton of nerfs, a ton of removal of mechanics, Akali still remains an overloaded champion and yet apparently still seen in pro play? (I don't watch pro play but I was told she had presence this year too).

This champion was a very toxic champion to the point that she even made the players toxic.
I mean, I saw a freaken thread of some guy who literally reports every Akali player whether they are on his team or enemy team. Reason? Simply for playing that champion. Nothing else. Doesn't matter on performance.
I feel like they gave her too much safety and power by making her dashes not point-&-click, since they forced to choose a target in order to use them. Now she can use them however she wants.

I won't disagree with you. Darius may seem oppressive to people who don't know how to play, but pair him against any competent riven, irelia, akali, and you just get shit on. If you pick him against like shen or cho, they just play safe and scale better for team fights or map presence. If you pick him against Camille, she can either just wear you down with quick short trades, or roam and get fed if she's not picking you off. Jax can beat darius early or play safe to scale if he needs to, same with tryn. Yeah, I'd say darius is pretty shit against most players with a brain, because he doesn't have enough burst or dps pre-five stacks, and with zero mobility or shields, a long cooldown pull, and a super low mana pool, other champs can just dodge and harass the shit out of him. Eventually he'll go oom and not be able to do anything but auto, or they simply all-in him with superior damage, mobility and cc, basically face tank him, and win (riven lolz). I mean, it's not hard for most of those champs do dodge his Q. His Q has the most counterplay of almost any ability in the game, and those champs are all geared towards taking advantage of the counterplay of other champs, while being near immune to being punished themselves (with the exceptions of shen and cho of course)

Since they intentionally designed and balanced her to be broken, no, it did not fail.

Is she balanced? No, but I don't think balance alone dictates whether the rework was a success or failure. When I think of a successful or failed rework I think more of whether the champion is in a better or worse spot now than they were before the rework, since I think that's the larger, overarching goal of reworks. I think she's in a better spot now than she was before so I would very loosely say it succeeded in that goal.

As players, she's a failure, because anytime a champ is only good to play as, but terrible in a toxic manner for EVERYONE to play against EVERYGAME, because that champ can outplay any champ, while being incredibly difficult to punish or exploit supposed "weaknesses", then it means that while akali players are having a better time, 5 enemy players are having a worse time. That's not success from a pure fun standpoint. But, from a playrate, skin sales, and skill cap level standpoint, sure, she was a success. But fuck riot and their money, I don't pay a penny for skins anymore.

Old akali basically did have some counterplay as you say, and if she screwed up, she got punished bad. Nowadays, she kills assassins, tanks, juggernauts, mages, mobile fighters, adcs...you name it. She's not an assassin truly in the balanced sense, instead she can duel and assassinate any class of champs with very little counterplay if she's skilled, and as the OP mentioned, if it looks dicey for her, she can easily dip out. IMO, she double dips in the rewards of too many tools. And I'm not ashamed to say, I have no respect for the updated akali mains. They simply abuse a very busted champ once they get good at her, and easily beat players that are better than them, even if they should be losing some of those matchups.

It did not fail. 

Her kit was also not overloaded. It had a similar number of effects as other champions released in the last few years.

It was however VERY powerful, and was unfortunately unhealthy for the game. I really miss the heal on her Q, and the obscure on her W, and the stun on her R.  But if they had just nerfed her damage, she wouldn't scale at all, and would be awesome, but useless.   

Just like a really good zed player, a great akali player can make it feel impossible to play against her, leaving so few windows of attack against her that unless you can capitalize on them, it feels unwinnable.  Same thing as Zed, where it can feel you have no ability to even target him before you are dead.

Akali's new style is great, and her gameplay can be fun to play, so no, I don't think it failed, just came out too powerful.
